comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: There no longer appears to be anything blocked by .NET Core; however, the cmdlet doesn't exist at all in `CORECLR` builds of PowerShell. If it is in newer builds of Core PowerShell, then we'll get this for free.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: The cmdlet is now in Core PowerShell with the latest updates.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: But it still doesn't work. Investigating.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
Nevermind, it is indeed not in Core PowerShell.

I found the Utility module definitions files (there's apparently a separate one for CoreCLR) and diffed them. These are the cmdlets we won't have in Core PowerShell's Utility module:

```
> "ConvertFrom-String"
> "ConvertTo-Html"
> "Export-PSSession"
> "Get-TraceSource"
> "Import-PSSession"
> "Invoke-RestMethod"
> "Invoke-WebRequest"
> "Out-GridView"
> "Out-Printer"
> "Send-MailMessage"
> "Set-TraceSource"
> "Show-Command"
> "Trace-Command"
> "Update-List"
```

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: @andschwa Can we re-open this one? We've got it on our radar for Aug17, and @maertend, @Francisco-Gamino, and @neemas need an Issue to track the work. If you'd rather, we can also open another Issue.
